summary:
{
  "summary": "The module provides a set of utility functions that support patch‑based inference workflows. It includes helpers for generating patch coordinates, managing slice buffers, flattening and packing nested structures, calculating scan intervals, and performing sliding‑window inference. The sliding‑window inference function extracts and applies a model to multiple overlapping patch es and re‑ re‑re re and re ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ...",
  "business_intent": ...



We need to produce JSON with summary, business_intent, keywords list. Must not include function names verbatim. Provide concise summary. The previous attempt had garbled text. Need to produce proper JSON.

File: monai/inferers/utils.py. Provide utilities for patch-based inference: coordinate generation, slice buffering, flatten/pack, scan interval, sliding-window inference routine that extracts overlapping patches, applies model, blends outputs, handles padding and meta-tensor info.

We need keywords: sliding window inference, patch extraction, overlapping patches, coordinate generation, slice buffer, flattening, packing, scan interval, padding, meta-tensor, medical imaging, MONAI, inference utilities.

Business intent: support efficient large-volume inference by handling patch extraction, model application, and result aggregation, reducing memory usage and simplifying pipeline.

Make sure not to list function names verbatim. So we can refer to "coordinate generation helper", "slice buffer manager", "structure flattening/packing utilities", "scan interval calculator", "sliding-window inference routine". Avoid naming functions like "generate_grid_coordinates". That's okay.

Now produce JSON.
